title: What's News: Business & Finance
text:
Goldman Sachs, Morgan Stanley, Citigroup and Wells Fargo reported double-digit declines in profit for the first quarter, and they all posted lower revenue.

U.S. stocks fell, with major indexes posting weekly losses. The S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow retreated 1.2%, 2.1% and 0.3%, respectively, on Thursday.

The ECB will continue to lag behind the Federal Reserve in tightening monetary policy despite rising inflation, Lagarde said.

TSMC signaled that the global semiconductor shortage is likely to continue, with tight production capacity for all types of chips it makes.

Amazon CEO Jassy said he wants to improve worker safety and make additional progress on reducing the company's carbon footprint.

Warner Bros. Discovery chief Zaslav told employees that he wants CNN to focus on maximizing its impact, not profitability.

Peloton will cut prices of its stationary bikes and treadmills and raise monthly subscriptions for online workout classes.

What's News: Business & Finance
